change_comment: Added SYS->FUNC compose relationship for logical architecture (top-level functions directly under system)

SYS.description: System that can contain other systems or use cases

ACTOR.description: External entity that interacts with functions

UC.description: Use case that organizes functions and can contain other use cases

FCHAIN.description: Function chain representing a sequence of related functions. It describes the functions affected for realization of a use case or sub use case

FUNC.description: Function representing a specific capability or action

FLOW.description: Data flow contract between functions or actors

TEST.description: Verification of functions or validation of use cases

MOD.description: A module that contains functions in the realization of the system

SCHEMA.description: Global Definitions. Standardized data structure, configurations or states

required_properties.Name: string (max 25 chars, PascalCase)
required_properties.Struct: Stringified JSON of the Datastructure as pseudo code

io.description: Input/Output connection between functions, flows, and actors

allocate.description: Represents allocation of functions to physical elements

relation.description: Represents a generic Relation. Any to Any

rules.description: All names must start with uppercase letter and not exceed 25 characters
All elements must have at least one link to another element
A Function must have at least one requirement
A Function must have at least one input and one output via io relationships to FLOW nodes
A FLOW node must have at least one incoming io relationship and one outgoing io relationship
A functional flow must have an Actor as input an Actor as output, connected through FLOW nodes and include at least one Function
All elements within a function flow or chain (FCHAIN) must be connected through io relationships via FLOW nodes, with no isolated elements
io relationships may form cycles, but each cycle must have at least one exit path to ensure the flow can progress to completion
Each function must be allocated to excactly one MOD element
Each Requirement must have at least one Test
A leaf use case (one without child use cases) must have at least one composed actor
every data structure, state or definition outside of a module need to be defined by a scheme node.
